summary: The Quality Loss Adjustment Improvement for Farmers Act (H.R. 442) amends the Federal Crop Insurance Act to enhance quality loss adjustment coverage. It mandates periodic reviews of quality loss procedures every five years, starting in 2025, requiring engagement from diverse industry stakeholders. The bill also requires reports on these reviews to be submitted to Congress. Additionally, it directs the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to establish state or regional discount factors for soybeans in areas affected by disasters or salvage market conditions, ensuring these factors are included in the periodic reviews and reports.
